history.heading: Non-“space-qualified” “focal plane arrays” as follows:
history.title: Non-“space-qualified” “focal plane arrays” as follows:

supplement.heading: Supplement No. 1 to Part 774 - The Commerce Control List

breadcrumbs: 6A002 Optical sensors and equipment, and “components” therefor, as follows (see List of Items Controlled).

content.html:
N.B.:

'Microbolometer' non-“space-qualified” “focal plane arrays” are only specified by 6A002.a.3.f.
content.text: N.B.: 'Microbolometer' non-“space-qualified” “focal plane arrays” are only specified by 6A002.a.3.f.

content.html:
Technical Note:

Linear or two-dimensional multi-element detector arrays are referred to as “focal plane arrays”;
content.text: Technical Note: Linear or two-dimensional multi-element detector arrays are referred to as “focal plane arrays”;

content.html:
Note 1:

6A002.a.3 includes photoconductive arrays and photovoltaic arrays.
content.text: Note 1: 6A002.a.3 includes photoconductive arrays and photovoltaic arrays.

content.html:
Note 2:

6A002.a.3 does not control:

a. Multi-element (not to exceed 16 elements) encapsulated photoconductive cells using either lead sulphide or lead selenide;

b. Pyroelectric detectors using any of the following:

b.1. Triglycine sulphate and variants;

b.2. Lead-lanthanum-zirconium titanate and variants;

b.3. Lithium tantalate;

b.4. Polyvinylidene fluoride and variants; or

b.5. Strontium barium niobate and variants.

c. “Focal plane arrays” “specially designed” or modified to achieve 'charge multiplication' and limited by design to have a maximum “radiant sensitivity” of 10 mA/W or less for wavelengths exceeding 760 nm, having all of the following:

c.1. Incorporating a response limiting mechanism designed not to be removed or modified; and

c.2. Any of the following:

c.2.a. The response limiting mechanism is integral to or combined with the detector element; or

c.2.b. The “focal plane array” is only operable with the response limiting mechanism in place.

d. Thermopile arrays having less than 5,130 elements;
content.text: Note 2: 6A002.a.3 does not control: a. Multi-element (not to exceed 16 elements) encapsulated photoconductive cells using either lead sulphide or lead selenide; b. Pyroelectric detectors using any of the following: b.1. Triglycine sulphate and variants; b.2. Lead-lanthanum-zirconium titanate and variants; b.3. Lithium tantalate; b.4. Polyvinylidene fluoride and variants; or b.5. Strontium barium niobate and variants. c. “Focal plane arrays” “specially designed” or modified to achieve 'charge multiplication' and limited by design to have a maximum “radiant sensitivity” of 10 mA/W or less for wavelengths exceeding 760 nm, having all of the following: c.1. Incorporating a response limiting mechanism designed not to be removed or modified; and c.2. Any of the following: c.2.a. The response limiting mechanism is integral to or combined with the detector element; or c.2.b. The “focal plane array” is only operable with the response limiting mechanism in place. d. Thermopile arrays having less than 5,130 elements;

content.html:
Technical Note:

A response limiting mechanism integral to the detector element is designed not to be removed or modified without rendering the detector inoperable.
content.text: Technical Note: A response limiting mechanism integral to the detector element is designed not to be removed or modified without rendering the detector inoperable.

Technical Note:

children.label: 6A002.a.3.f – Non-“space-qualified” non-linear (2-dimensional) infrared “focal plane arrays” based on ‘microbolometer’ material having individual elements with an unfiltered response in the wavelength range equal to or exceeding 8,000 nm but not exceeding 14,000 nm;

content.html: a.3.f. Non-“space-qualified” non-linear (2-dimensional) infrared “focal plane arrays” based on ‘microbolometer’ material having individual elements with an unfiltered response in the wavelength range equal to or exceeding 8,000 nm but not exceeding 14,000 nm;

content.html:
Technical Note:

For the purposes of 6A002.a.3.f, ‘microbolometer’ is defined as a thermal imaging detector that, as a result of a temperature change in the detector caused by the absorption of infrared radiation, is used to generate any usable signal.

N.B.:

'Microbolometer' non-“space-qualified” “focal plane arrays” are only specified by 6A002.a.3.f.
content.text: N.B.: 'Microbolometer' non-“space-qualified” “focal plane arrays” are only specified by 6A002.a.3.f.

content.html:
Technical Note:

Linear or two-dimensional multi-element detector arrays are referred to as “focal plane arrays”;
content.text: Technical Note: Linear or two-dimensional multi-element detector arrays are referred to as “focal plane arrays”;

content.html:
Note 1:

6A002.a.3 includes photoconductive arrays and photovoltaic arrays.
content.text: Note 1: 6A002.a.3 includes photoconductive arrays and photovoltaic arrays.

content.html:
Note 2:

6A002.a.3 does not control:

a. Multi-element (not to exceed 16 elements) encapsulated photoconductive cells using either lead sulphide or lead selenide;

b. Pyroelectric detectors using any of the following:

b.1. Triglycine sulphate and variants;

b.2. Lead-lanthanum-zirconium titanate and variants;

b.3. Lithium tantalate;

b.4. Polyvinylidene fluoride and variants; or

b.5. Strontium barium niobate and variants.

c. “Focal plane arrays” “specially designed” or modified to achieve 'charge multiplication' and limited by design to have a maximum “radiant sensitivity” of 10 mA/W or less for wavelengths exceeding 760 nm, having all of the following:

c.1. Incorporating a response limiting mechanism designed not to be removed or modified; and

c.2. Any of the following:

c.2.a. The response limiting mechanism is integral to or combined with the detector element; or

c.2.b. The “focal plane array” is only operable with the response limiting mechanism in place.

d. Thermopile arrays having less than 5,130 elements;
content.text: Note 2: 6A002.a.3 does not control: a. Multi-element (not to exceed 16 elements) encapsulated photoconductive cells using either lead sulphide or lead selenide; b. Pyroelectric detectors using any of the following: b.1. Triglycine sulphate and variants; b.2. Lead-lanthanum-zirconium titanate and variants; b.3. Lithium tantalate; b.4. Polyvinylidene fluoride and variants; or b.5. Strontium barium niobate and variants. c. “Focal plane arrays” “specially designed” or modified to achieve 'charge multiplication' and limited by design to have a maximum “radiant sensitivity” of 10 mA/W or less for wavelengths exceeding 760 nm, having all of the following: c.1. Incorporating a response limiting mechanism designed not to be removed or modified; and c.2. Any of the following: c.2.a. The response limiting mechanism is integral to or combined with the detector element; or c.2.b. The “focal plane array” is only operable with the response limiting mechanism in place. d. Thermopile arrays having less than 5,130 elements;

content.html:
Technical Note:

A response limiting mechanism integral to the detector element is designed not to be removed or modified without rendering the detector inoperable.
content.text: Technical Note: A response limiting mechanism integral to the detector element is designed not to be removed or modified without rendering the detector inoperable.

content.html:
N.B.:

'Microbolometer' non-“space-qualified” “focal plane arrays” are only specified by 6A002.a.3.f.
content.text: N.B.: 'Microbolometer' non-“space-qualified” “focal plane arrays” are only specified by 6A002.a.3.f.

content.html:
Technical Note:

Linear or two-dimensional multi-element detector arrays are referred to as “focal plane arrays”;
content.text: Technical Note: Linear or two-dimensional multi-element detector arrays are referred to as “focal plane arrays”;

content.html:
Note 1:

6A002.a.3 includes photoconductive arrays and photovoltaic arrays.
content.text: Note 1: 6A002.a.3 includes photoconductive arrays and photovoltaic arrays.

content.html:
Note 2:

6A002.a.3 does not control:

a. Multi-element (not to exceed 16 elements) encapsulated photoconductive cells using either lead sulphide or lead selenide;

b. Pyroelectric detectors using any of the following:

b.1. Triglycine sulphate and variants;

b.2. Lead-lanthanum-zirconium titanate and variants;

b.3. Lithium tantalate;

b.4. Polyvinylidene fluoride and variants; or

b.5. Strontium barium niobate and variants.

c. “Focal plane arrays” “specially designed” or modified to achieve 'charge multiplication' and limited by design to have a maximum “radiant sensitivity” of 10 mA/W or less for wavelengths exceeding 760 nm, having all of the following:

c.1. Incorporating a response limiting mechanism designed not to be removed or modified; and

c.2. Any of the following:

c.2.a. The response limiting mechanism is integral to or combined with the detector element; or

c.2.b. The “focal plane array” is only operable with the response limiting mechanism in place.

d. Thermopile arrays having less than 5,130 elements;
content.text: Note 2: 6A002.a.3 does not control: a. Multi-element (not to exceed 16 elements) encapsulated photoconductive cells using either lead sulphide or lead selenide; b. Pyroelectric detectors using any of the following: b.1. Triglycine sulphate and variants; b.2. Lead-lanthanum-zirconium titanate and variants; b.3. Lithium tantalate; b.4. Polyvinylidene fluoride and variants; or b.5. Strontium barium niobate and variants. c. “Focal plane arrays” “specially designed” or modified to achieve 'charge multiplication' and limited by design to have a maximum “radiant sensitivity” of 10 mA/W or less for wavelengths exceeding 760 nm, having all of the following: c.1. Incorporating a response limiting mechanism designed not to be removed or modified; and c.2. Any of the following: c.2.a. The response limiting mechanism is integral to or combined with the detector element; or c.2.b. The “focal plane array” is only operable with the response limiting mechanism in place. d. Thermopile arrays having less than 5,130 elements;

content.html:
Technical Note:

A response limiting mechanism integral to the detector element is designed not to be removed or modified without rendering the detector inoperable.
content.text: Technical Note: A response limiting mechanism integral to the detector element is designed not to be removed or modified without rendering the detector inoperable.

Strontium barium niobate and variants. c. “Focal plane arrays” “specially designed” or modified to achieve 'charge multiplication' and limited by design to have a maximum “radiant sensitivity” of 10 mA/W or less for wavelengths exceeding 760 nm, having all of the following: c.1. Incorporating a response limiting mechanism designed not to be removed or modified; and c.2. Any of the following: c.2.a. The response limiting mechanism is integral to or combined with the detector element; or c.2.b. The “focal plane array” is only operable with the response limiting mechanism in place. d. Thermopile arrays having less than 5,130 elements;

content.html:
Technical Note:

A response limiting mechanism integral to the detector element is designed not to be removed or modified without rendering the detector inoperable.

content.html:
N.B.:

'Microbolometer' non-“space-qualified” “focal plane arrays” are only specified by 6A002.a.3.f.
content.text: N.B.: 'Microbolometer' non-“space-qualified” “focal plane arrays” are only specified by 6A002.a.3.f.

content.html:
Technical Note:

Linear or two-dimensional multi-element detector arrays are referred to as “focal plane arrays”;
content.text: Technical Note: Linear or two-dimensional multi-element detector arrays are referred to as “focal plane arrays”;

content.html:
Note 1:

6A002.a.3 includes photoconductive arrays and photovoltaic arrays.
content.text: Note 1: 6A002.a.3 includes photoconductive arrays and photovoltaic arrays.

content.html:
Note 2:

6A002.a.3 does not control:

a. Multi-element (not to exceed 16 elements) encapsulated photoconductive cells using either lead sulphide or lead selenide;

b. Pyroelectric detectors using any of the following:

b.1. Triglycine sulphate and variants;

b.2. Lead-lanthanum-zirconium titanate and variants;

b.3. Lithium tantalate;

b.4. Polyvinylidene fluoride and variants; or

b.5. Strontium barium niobate and variants.

c. “Focal plane arrays” “specially designed” or modified to achieve 'charge multiplication' and limited by design to have a maximum “radiant sensitivity” of 10 mA/W or less for wavelengths exceeding 760 nm, having all of the following:

c.1. Incorporating a response limiting mechanism designed not to be removed or modified; and

c.2. Any of the following:

c.2.a. The response limiting mechanism is integral to or combined with the detector element; or

c.2.b. The “focal plane array” is only operable with the response limiting mechanism in place.

d. Thermopile arrays having less than 5,130 elements;
content.text: Note 2: 6A002.a.3 does not control: a. Multi-element (not to exceed 16 elements) encapsulated photoconductive cells using either lead sulphide or lead selenide; b. Strontium barium niobate and variants. c. “Focal plane arrays” “specially designed” or modified to achieve 'charge multiplication' and limited by design to have a maximum “radiant sensitivity” of 10 mA/W or less for wavelengths exceeding 760 nm, having all of the following: c.1. The response limiting mechanism is integral to or combined with the detector element; or c.2.b. The “focal plane array” is only operable with the response limiting mechanism in place. d. Thermopile arrays having less than 5,130 elements;

A response limiting mechanism integral to the detector element is designed not to be removed or modified without rendering the detector inoperable.

content.html:
N.B.:

'Microbolometer' non-“space-qualified” “focal plane arrays” are only specified by 6A002.a.3.f.
content.text: N.B.: 'Microbolometer' non-“space-qualified” “focal plane arrays” are only specified by 6A002.a.3.f.

content.html:
Technical Note:

Linear or two-dimensional multi-element detector arrays are referred to as “focal plane arrays”;
content.text: Technical Note: Linear or two-dimensional multi-element detector arrays are referred to as “focal plane arrays”;

content.html:
Note 1:

6A002.a.3 includes photoconductive arrays and photovoltaic arrays.
content.text: Note 1: 6A002.a.3 includes photoconductive arrays and photovoltaic arrays.

content.html:
Note 2:

6A002.a.3 does not control:

a. Multi-element (not to exceed 16 elements) encapsulated photoconductive cells using either lead sulphide or lead selenide;

b. Pyroelectric detectors using any of the following:

b.1. Triglycine sulphate and variants;

b.2. Lead-lanthanum-zirconium titanate and variants;

b.3. Lithium tantalate;

b.4. Polyvinylidene fluoride and variants; or

b.5. Strontium barium niobate and variants.

c. “Focal plane arrays” “specially designed” or modified to achieve 'charge multiplication' and limited by design to have a maximum “radiant sensitivity” of 10 mA/W or less for wavelengths exceeding 760 nm, having all of the following:

c.1. Incorporating a response limiting mechanism designed not to be removed or modified; and

c.2. Any of the following:

c.2.a. The response limiting mechanism is integral to or combined with the detector element; or

c.2.b. The “focal plane array” is only operable with the response limiting mechanism in place.

d. Thermopile arrays having less than 5,130 elements;
content.text: Note 2: 6A002.a.3 does not control: a. Multi-element (not to exceed 16 elements) encapsulated photoconductive cells using either lead sulphide or lead selenide; b. Pyroelectric detectors using any of the following: b.1. Triglycine sulphate and variants; b.2. Lead-lanthanum-zirconium titanate and variants; b.3. Lithium tantalate; b.4. Polyvinylidene fluoride and variants; or b.5. Strontium barium niobate and variants. c. “Focal plane arrays” “specially designed” or modified to achieve 'charge multiplication' and limited by design to have a maximum “radiant sensitivity” of 10 mA/W or less for wavelengths exceeding 760 nm, having all of the following: c.1. Incorporating a response limiting mechanism designed not to be removed or modified; and c.2. Any of the following: c.2.a. The response limiting mechanism is integral to or combined with the detector element; or c.2.b. The “focal plane array” is only operable with the response limiting mechanism in place. d. Thermopile arrays having less than 5,130 elements;

content.html:
Technical Note:

A response limiting mechanism integral to the detector element is designed not to be removed or modified without rendering the detector inoperable.
content.text: Technical Note: A response limiting mechanism integral to the detector element is designed not to be removed or modified without rendering the detector inoperable.

content.html:
N.B.:

'Microbolometer' non-“space-qualified” “focal plane arrays” are only specified by 6A002.a.3.f.
content.text: N.B.: 'Microbolometer' non-“space-qualified” “focal plane arrays” are only specified by 6A002.a.3.f.

content.html:
Technical Note:

Linear or two-dimensional multi-element detector arrays are referred to as “focal plane arrays”;
content.text: Technical Note: Linear or two-dimensional multi-element detector arrays are referred to as “focal plane arrays”;

content.html:
Note 1:

6A002.a.3 includes photoconductive arrays and photovoltaic arrays.
content.text: Note 1: 6A002.a.3 includes photoconductive arrays and photovoltaic arrays.

content.html:
Note 2:

6A002.a.3 does not control:

a. Multi-element (not to exceed 16 elements) encapsulated photoconductive cells using either lead sulphide or lead selenide;

b. Pyroelectric detectors using any of the following:

b.1. Triglycine sulphate and variants;

b.2. Lead-lanthanum-zirconium titanate and variants;

b.3. Lithium tantalate;

b.4. Polyvinylidene fluoride and variants; or

b.5. Strontium barium niobate and variants.

c. “Focal plane arrays” “specially designed” or modified to achieve 'charge multiplication' and limited by design to have a maximum “radiant sensitivity” of 10 mA/W or less for wavelengths exceeding 760 nm, having all of the following:

c.1. Incorporating a response limiting mechanism designed not to be removed or modified; and

c.2. Any of the following:

c.2.a. The response limiting mechanism is integral to or combined with the detector element; or

c.2.b. The “focal plane array” is only operable with the response limiting mechanism in place.

d. Thermopile arrays having less than 5,130 elements;
content.text: Note 2: 6A002.a.3 does not control: a. Multi-element (not to exceed 16 elements) encapsulated photoconductive cells using either lead sulphide or lead selenide; b. Pyroelectric detectors using any of the following: b.1. Triglycine sulphate and variants; b.2. Lead-lanthanum-zirconium titanate and variants; b.3. Lithium tantalate; b.4. Polyvinylidene fluoride and variants; or b.5. Strontium barium niobate and variants. c. “Focal plane arrays” “specially designed” or modified to achieve 'charge multiplication' and limited by design to have a maximum “radiant sensitivity” of 10 mA/W or less for wavelengths exceeding 760 nm, having all of the following: c.1. Incorporating a response limiting mechanism designed not to be removed or modified; and c.2. Any of the following: c.2.a. The response limiting mechanism is integral to or combined with the detector element; or c.2.b. The “focal plane array” is only operable with the response limiting mechanism in place. d. Thermopile arrays having less than 5,130 elements;

content.html:
Technical Note:

A response limiting mechanism integral to the detector element is designed not to be removed or modified without rendering the detector inoperable.
content.text: Technical Note: A response limiting mechanism integral to the detector element is designed not to be removed or modified without rendering the detector inoperable.

breadcrumbs: 6A002 Optical sensors and equipment, and “components” therefor, as follows (see List of Items Controlled).

content.html:
N.B.:

'Microbolometer' non-“space-qualified” “focal plane arrays” are only specified by 6A002.a.3.f.
content.text: N.B.: 'Microbolometer' non-“space-qualified” “focal plane arrays” are only specified by 6A002.a.3.f.

content.html:
Technical Note:

Linear or two-dimensional multi-element detector arrays are referred to as “focal plane arrays”;
content.text: Technical Note: Linear or two-dimensional multi-element detector arrays are referred to as “focal plane arrays”;

content.html:
Note 1:

6A002.a.3 includes photoconductive arrays and photovoltaic arrays.
content.text: Note 1: 6A002.a.3 includes photoconductive arrays and photovoltaic arrays.

content.html:
Note 2:

6A002.a.3 does not control:

a. Multi-element (not to exceed 16 elements) encapsulated photoconductive cells using either lead sulphide or lead selenide;

b. Pyroelectric detectors using any of the following:

b.1. Triglycine sulphate and variants;

b.2. Lead-lanthanum-zirconium titanate and variants;

b.3. Lithium tantalate;

b.4. Polyvinylidene fluoride and variants; or

b.5. Strontium barium niobate and variants.

c. “Focal plane arrays” “specially designed” or modified to achieve 'charge multiplication' and limited by design to have a maximum “radiant sensitivity” of 10 mA/W or less for wavelengths exceeding 760 nm, having all of the following:

c.1. Incorporating a response limiting mechanism designed not to be removed or modified; and

c.2. Any of the following:

c.2.a. The response limiting mechanism is integral to or combined with the detector element; or

c.2.b. The “focal plane array” is only operable with the response limiting mechanism in place.

d. Thermopile arrays having less than 5,130 elements;
content.text: Note 2: 6A002.a.3 does not control: a. Multi-element (not to exceed 16 elements) encapsulated photoconductive cells using either lead sulphide or lead selenide; b. Pyroelectric detectors using any of the following: b.1. Triglycine sulphate and variants; b.2. Lead-lanthanum-zirconium titanate and variants; b.3. Lithium tantalate; b.4. Polyvinylidene fluoride and variants; or b.5. Strontium barium niobate and variants. c. “Focal plane arrays” “specially designed” or modified to achieve 'charge multiplication' and limited by design to have a maximum “radiant sensitivity” of 10 mA/W or less for wavelengths exceeding 760 nm, having all of the following: c.1. Incorporating a response limiting mechanism designed not to be removed or modified; and c.2. Any of the following: c.2.a. The response limiting mechanism is integral to or combined with the detector element; or c.2.b. The “focal plane array” is only operable with the response limiting mechanism in place. d. Thermopile arrays having less than 5,130 elements;

content.html:
Technical Note:

A response limiting mechanism integral to the detector element is designed not to be removed or modified without rendering the detector inoperable.
content.text: Technical Note: A response limiting mechanism integral to the detector element is designed not to be removed or modified without rendering the detector inoperable.

content.text: N.B.: 'Microbolometer' non-“space-qualified” “focal plane arrays” are only specified by 6A002.a.3.f.

content.html:
Technical Note:

Linear or two-dimensional multi-element detector arrays are referred to as “focal plane arrays”;
content.text: Technical Note: Linear or two-dimensional multi-element detector arrays are referred to as “focal plane arrays”;

content.html:
Note 1:

6A002.a.3 includes photoconductive arrays and photovoltaic arrays.
content.text: Note 1: 6A002.a.3 includes photoconductive arrays and photovoltaic arrays.

content.html:
Note 2:

6A002.a.3 does not control:

a. Multi-element (not to exceed 16 elements) encapsulated photoconductive cells using either lead sulphide or lead selenide;

b. Pyroelectric detectors using any of the following:

b.1. Triglycine sulphate and variants;

b.2. Lead-lanthanum-zirconium titanate and variants;

b.3. Lithium tantalate;

b.4. Polyvinylidene fluoride and variants; or

b.5. Strontium barium niobate and variants.

c. “Focal plane arrays” “specially designed” or modified to achieve 'charge multiplication' and limited by design to have a maximum “radiant sensitivity” of 10 mA/W or less for wavelengths exceeding 760 nm, having all of the following:

c.1. Incorporating a response limiting mechanism designed not to be removed or modified; and

c.2. Any of the following:

c.2.a. The response limiting mechanism is integral to or combined with the detector element; or

c.2.b. The “focal plane array” is only operable with the response limiting mechanism in place.

d. Thermopile arrays having less than 5,130 elements;

Pyroelectric detectors using any of the following: b.1. Triglycine sulphate and variants; b.2. Lead-lanthanum-zirconium titanate and variants; b.3. Lithium tantalate; b.4. Polyvinylidene fluoride and variants; or b.5. Strontium barium niobate and variants. c. “Focal plane arrays” “specially designed” or modified to achieve 'charge multiplication' and limited by design to have a maximum “radiant sensitivity” of 10 mA/W or less for wavelengths exceeding 760 nm, having all of the following: c.1. Incorporating a response limiting mechanism designed not to be removed or modified; and c.2. Any of the following: c.2.a. The response limiting mechanism is integral to or combined with the detector element; or c.2.b. The “focal plane array” is only operable with the response limiting mechanism in place. d. Thermopile arrays having less than 5,130 elements;

content.html:
Technical Note:

A response limiting mechanism integral to the detector element is designed not to be removed or modified without rendering the detector inoperable.

content.html:
N.B.:

'Microbolometer' non-“space-qualified” “focal plane arrays” are only specified by 6A002.a.3.f.
content.text: N.B.: 'Microbolometer' non-“space-qualified” “focal plane arrays” are only specified by 6A002.a.3.f.

content.html:
Technical Note:

Linear or two-dimensional multi-element detector arrays are referred to as “focal plane arrays”;
content.text: Technical Note: Linear or two-dimensional multi-element detector arrays are referred to as “focal plane arrays”;

content.html:
Note 1:

6A002.a.3 includes photoconductive arrays and photovoltaic arrays.
content.text: Note 1: 6A002.a.3 includes photoconductive arrays and photovoltaic arrays.

content.html:
Note 2:

6A002.a.3 does not control:

a. Multi-element (not to exceed 16 elements) encapsulated photoconductive cells using either lead sulfide or lead selenide;

b. Pyroelectric detectors using any of the following:

b.1. Triglycine sulphate and variants;

b.2. Lead-lanthanum-zirconium titanate and variants;

b.3. Lithium tantalate;

b.4. Polyvinylidene fluoride and variants; or

b.5. Strontium barium niobate and variants.

c. “Focal plane arrays” “specially designed” or modified to achieve 'charge multiplication' and limited by design to have a maximum “radiant sensitivity” of 10 mA/W or less for wavelengths exceeding 760 nm, having all of the following:

c.1. Incorporating a response limiting mechanism designed not to be removed or modified; and

c.2. Any of the following:

c.2.a. The response limiting mechanism is integral to or combined with the detector element; or

c.2.b. The “focal plane array” is only operable with the response limiting mechanism in place.

d. Thermopile arrays having less than 5,130 elements;
content.text: Note 2: 6A002.a.3 does not control: a. Multi-element (not to exceed 16 elements) encapsulated photoconductive cells using either lead sulfide or lead selenide; b. Pyroelectric detectors using any of the following: b.1. Triglycine sulphate and variants; b.2. Lead-lanthanum-zirconium titanate and variants; b.3. Lithium tantalate; b.4. Polyvinylidene fluoride and variants; or b.5. Strontium barium niobate and variants. c. “Focal plane arrays” “specially designed” or modified to achieve 'charge multiplication' and limited by design to have a maximum “radiant sensitivity” of 10 mA/W or less for wavelengths exceeding 760 nm, having all of the following: c.1. Incorporating a response limiting mechanism designed not to be removed or modified; and c.2. Any of the following: c.2.a. The response limiting mechanism is integral to or combined with the detector element; or c.2.b. The “focal plane array” is only operable with the response limiting mechanism in place. d. Thermopile arrays having less than 5,130 elements;

content.html:
Technical Note:

A response limiting mechanism integral to the detector element is designed not to be removed or modified without rendering the detector inoperable.
content.text: Technical Note: A response limiting mechanism integral to the detector element is designed not to be removed or modified without rendering the detector inoperable.

content.html: N.B.: 'Microbolometer' non-“space-qualified” “focal plane arrays” are only specified by 6A002.a.3.f.
content.text: N.B.: 'Microbolometer' non-“space-qualified” “focal plane arrays” are only specified by 6A002.a.3.f.

content.html:
Technical Note:

Linear or two-dimensional multi-element detector arrays are referred to as “focal plane arrays”;
content.text: Technical Note: Linear or two-dimensional multi-element detector arrays are referred to as “focal plane arrays”;

content.html:
Note 1:

6A002.a.3 includes photoconductive arrays and photovoltaic arrays.
content.text: Note 1: 6A002.a.3 includes photoconductive arrays and photovoltaic arrays.

content.html:
Note 2:

6A002.a.3 does not control:

a. Multi-element (not to exceed 16 elements) encapsulated photoconductive cells using either lead sulphide or lead selenide;

b. Pyroelectric detectors using any of the following:

b.1. Triglycine sulphate and variants;

b.2. Lead-lanthanum-zirconium titanate and variants;

b.3. Lithium tantalate;

b.4. Polyvinylidene fluoride and variants; or

b.5. Strontium barium niobate and variants.

c. “Focal plane arrays” “specially designed” or modified to achieve `charge multiplication' and limited by design to have a maximum “radiant sensitivity” of 10 mA/W or less for wavelengths exceeding 760 nm, having all of the following:

c.1. Incorporating a response limiting mechanism designed not to be removed or modified; and

c.2. Any of the following:

c.2.a. The response limiting mechanism is integral to or combined with the detector element; or

c.2.b. The “focal plane array” is only operable with the response limiting mechanism in place.

d. Thermopile arrays having less than 5,130 elements;
content.text: Note 2: 6A002.a.3 does not control: a. Multi-element (not to exceed 16 elements) encapsulated photoconductive cells using either lead sulphide or lead selenide; b. Pyroelectric detectors using any of the following: b.1. Triglycine sulphate and variants; b.2. Lead-lanthanum-zirconium titanate and variants; b.3. Lithium tantalate; b.4. Polyvinylidene fluoride and variants; or b.5. Strontium barium niobate and variants. c. “Focal plane arrays” “specially designed” or modified to achieve `charge multiplication' and limited by design to have a maximum “radiant sensitivity” of 10 mA/W or less for wavelengths exceeding 760 nm, having all of the following: c.1. Incorporating a response limiting mechanism designed not to be removed or modified; and c.2. Any of the following: c.2.a. The response limiting mechanism is integral to or combined with the detector element; or c.2.b. The “focal plane array” is only operable with the response limiting mechanism in place. d. Thermopile arrays having less than 5,130 elements;

content.html:
Technical Note:

A response limiting mechanism integral to the detector element is designed not to be removed or modified without rendering the detector inoperable.
content.text: Technical Note: A response limiting mechanism integral to the detector element is designed not to be removed or modified without rendering the detector inoperable.

content.html: N.B.: 'Microbolometer' non-“space-qualified” “focal plane arrays” are only specified by 6A002.a.3.f.
content.text: N.B.: 'Microbolometer' non-“space-qualified” “focal plane arrays” are only specified by 6A002.a.3.f.

content.html:
Technical Note:

Linear or two-dimensional multi-element detector arrays are referred to as “focal plane arrays”;
content.text: Technical Note: Linear or two-dimensional multi-element detector arrays are referred to as “focal plane arrays”;

content.html:
Note 1:

6A002.a.3 includes photoconductive arrays and photovoltaic arrays.
content.text: Note 1: 6A002.a.3 includes photoconductive arrays and photovoltaic arrays.

content.html:
Note 2:

6A002.a.3 does not control:

a. Multi-element (not to exceed 16 elements) encapsulated photoconductive cells using either lead sulphide or lead selenide;

b. Pyroelectric detectors using any of the following:

b.1. Triglycine sulphate and variants;

b.2. Lead-lanthanum-zirconium titanate and variants;

b.3. Lithium tantalate;

b.4. Polyvinylidene fluoride and variants; or

b.5. Strontium barium niobate and variants.

c. “Focal plane arrays” “specially designed” or modified to achieve `charge multiplication' and limited by design to have a maximum “radiant sensitivity” of 10 mA/W or less for wavelengths exceeding 760 nm, having all of the following:

c.1. Incorporating a response limiting mechanism designed not to be removed or modified; and

c.2. Any of the following:

c.2.a. The response limiting mechanism is integral to or combined with the detector element; or

c.2.b. The “focal plane array” is only operable with the response limiting mechanism in place.

d. Thermopile arrays having less than 5,130 elements;
content.text: Note 2: 6A002.a.3 does not control: a. Multi-element (not to exceed 16 elements) encapsulated photoconductive cells using either lead sulphide or lead selenide; b. Pyroelectric detectors using any of the following: b.1. Triglycine sulphate and variants; b.2. Lead-lanthanum-zirconium titanate and variants; b.3. Lithium tantalate; b.4. Polyvinylidene fluoride and variants; or b.5. Strontium barium niobate and variants. c. “Focal plane arrays” “specially designed” or modified to achieve `charge multiplication' and limited by design to have a maximum “radiant sensitivity” of 10 mA/W or less for wavelengths exceeding 760 nm, having all of the following: c.1. Incorporating a response limiting mechanism designed not to be removed or modified; and c.2. Any of the following: c.2.a. The response limiting mechanism is integral to or combined with the detector element; or c.2.b. The “focal plane array” is only operable with the response limiting mechanism in place. d. Thermopile arrays having less than 5,130 elements;

content.html:
Technical Note:

A response limiting mechanism integral to the detector element is designed not to be removed or modified without rendering the detector inoperable.

content.html: N.B.: 'Microbolometer' non-“space-qualified” “focal plane arrays” are only specified by 6A002.a.3.f.
content.text: N.B.: 'Microbolometer' non-“space-qualified” “focal plane arrays” are only specified by 6A002.a.3.f.

content.html:
Technical Note:

Linear or two-dimensional multi-element detector arrays are referred to as “focal plane arrays”;
content.text: Technical Note: Linear or two-dimensional multi-element detector arrays are referred to as “focal plane arrays”;

content.html:
Note 1:

6A002.a.3 includes photoconductive arrays and photovoltaic arrays.
content.text: Note 1: 6A002.a.3 includes photoconductive arrays and photovoltaic arrays.

content.html:
Note 2:

6A002.a.3 does not control:

a. Multi-element (not to exceed 16 elements) encapsulated photoconductive cells using either lead sulphide or lead selenide;

b. Pyroelectric detectors using any of the following:

b.1. Triglycine sulphate and variants;

b.2. Lead-lanthanum-zirconium titanate and variants;

b.3. Lithium tantalate;

b.4. Polyvinylidene fluoride and variants; or

b.5. Strontium barium niobate and variants.

c. “Focal plane arrays” “specially designed” or modified to achieve `charge multiplication' and limited by design to have a maximum “radiant sensitivity” of 10 mA/W or less for wavelengths exceeding 760 nm, having all of the following:

c.1. Incorporating a response limiting mechanism designed not to be removed or modified; and

c.2. Any of the following:

c.2.a. The response limiting mechanism is integral to or combined with the detector element; or

c.2.b. The “focal plane array” is only operable with the response limiting mechanism in place.

d. Thermopile arrays having less than 5,130 elements;
content.text: Note 2: 6A002.a.3 does not control: a. Multi-element (not to exceed 16 elements) encapsulated photoconductive cells using either lead sulphide or lead selenide; b. Pyroelectric detectors using any of the following: b.1. Triglycine sulphate and variants; b.2. Lead-lanthanum-zirconium titanate and variants; b.3. Lithium tantalate; b.4. Polyvinylidene fluoride and variants; or b.5. Strontium barium niobate and variants. c. “Focal plane arrays” “specially designed” or modified to achieve `charge multiplication' and limited by design to have a maximum “radiant sensitivity” of 10 mA/W or less for wavelengths exceeding 760 nm, having all of the following: c.1. Incorporating a response limiting mechanism designed not to be removed or modified; and c.2. Any of the following: c.2.a. The response limiting mechanism is integral to or combined with the detector element; or c.2.b. The “focal plane array” is only operable with the response limiting mechanism in place. d. Thermopile arrays having less than 5,130 elements;

content.html:
Technical Note:

A response limiting mechanism integral to the detector element is designed not to be removed or modified without rendering the detector inoperable.
content.text: Technical Note: A response limiting mechanism integral to the detector element is designed not to be removed or modified without rendering the detector inoperable.

content.html:
Technical Note:

For the purposes of 6A002.a.3.d, 'cross-scan direction' is defined as the axis parallel to the linear array of detector elements and the 'scan direction' is defined as the axis perpendicular to the linear array of detector elements.

content.html: N.B.: 'Microbolometer' non-“space-qualified” “focal plane arrays” are only specified by 6A002.a.3.f.
content.text: N.B.: 'Microbolometer' non-“space-qualified” “focal plane arrays” are only specified by 6A002.a.3.f.

content.html:
Technical Note:

Linear or two-dimensional multi-element detector arrays are referred to as “focal plane arrays”;
content.text: Technical Note: Linear or two-dimensional multi-element detector arrays are referred to as “focal plane arrays”;

content.html:
Note 1:

6A002.a.3 includes photoconductive arrays and photovoltaic arrays.
content.text: Note 1: 6A002.a.3 includes photoconductive arrays and photovoltaic arrays.

content.html:
Note 2:

6A002.a.3 does not control:

a. Multi-element (not to exceed 16 elements) encapsulated photoconductive cells using either lead sulphide or lead selenide;

b. Pyroelectric detectors using any of the following:

b.1. Triglycine sulphate and variants;

b.2. Lead-lanthanum-zirconium titanate and variants;

b.3. Lithium tantalate;

b.4. Polyvinylidene fluoride and variants; or

b.5. Strontium barium niobate and variants.

c. “Focal plane arrays” “specially designed” or modified to achieve `charge multiplication' and limited by design to have a maximum “radiant sensitivity” of 10 mA/W or less for wavelengths exceeding 760 nm, having all of the following:

c.1. Incorporating a response limiting mechanism designed not to be removed or modified; and

c.2. Any of the following:

c.2.a. The response limiting mechanism is integral to or combined with the detector element; or

c.2.b. The “focal plane array” is only operable with the response limiting mechanism in place.

d. Thermopile arrays having less than 5,130 elements;
content.text: Note 2: 6A002.a.3 does not control: a. Multi-element (not to exceed 16 elements) encapsulated photoconductive cells using either lead sulphide or lead selenide; b. Pyroelectric detectors using any of the following: b.1. Triglycine sulphate and variants; b.2. Lead-lanthanum-zirconium titanate and variants; b.3. Lithium tantalate; b.4. Polyvinylidene fluoride and variants; or b.5. Strontium barium niobate and variants. c. “Focal plane arrays” “specially designed” or modified to achieve `charge multiplication' and limited by design to have a maximum “radiant sensitivity” of 10 mA/W or less for wavelengths exceeding 760 nm, having all of the following: c.1. Incorporating a response limiting mechanism designed not to be removed or modified; and c.2. Any of the following: c.2.a. The response limiting mechanism is integral to or combined with the detector element; or c.2.b. The “focal plane array” is only operable with the response limiting mechanism in place. d. Thermopile arrays having less than 5,130 elements;

content.html:
Technical Note:

A response limiting mechanism integral to the detector element is designed not to be removed or modified without rendering the detector inoperable.
content.text: Technical Note: A response limiting mechanism integral to the detector element is designed not to be removed or modified without rendering the detector inoperable.

content.html: N.B.: 'Microbolometer' non-“space-qualified” “focal plane arrays” are only specified by 6A002.a.3.f.
content.text: N.B.: 'Microbolometer' non-“space-qualified” “focal plane arrays” are only specified by 6A002.a.3.f.

content.html:
Technical Note:

Linear or two-dimensional multi-element detector arrays are referred to as “focal plane arrays”;
content.text: Technical Note: Linear or two-dimensional multi-element detector arrays are referred to as “focal plane arrays”;

content.html:
Note 1:

6A002.a.3 includes photoconductive arrays and photovoltaic arrays.
content.text: Note 1: 6A002.a.3 includes photoconductive arrays and photovoltaic arrays.

content.html:
Note 2:

6A002.a.3 does not control:

a. Multi-element (not to exceed 16 elements) encapsulated photoconductive cells using either lead sulphide or lead selenide;

b. Pyroelectric detectors using any of the following:

b.1. Triglycine sulphate and variants;

b.2. Lead-lanthanum-zirconium titanate and variants;

b.3. Lithium tantalate;

b.4. Polyvinylidene fluoride and variants; or

b.5. Strontium barium niobate and variants.

c. “Focal plane arrays” “specially designed” or modified to achieve `charge multiplication' and limited by design to have a maximum “radiant sensitivity” of 10 mA/W or less for wavelengths exceeding 760 nm, having all of the following:

c.1. Incorporating a response limiting mechanism designed not to be removed or modified; and

c.2. Any of the following:

c.2.a. The response limiting mechanism is integral to or combined with the detector element; or

c.2.b. The “focal plane array” is only operable with the response limiting mechanism in place.

d. Thermopile arrays having less than 5,130 elements;
content.text: Note 2: 6A002.a.3 does not control: a. Multi-element (not to exceed 16 elements) encapsulated photoconductive cells using either lead sulphide or lead selenide; b. Pyroelectric detectors using any of the following: b.1. Triglycine sulphate and variants; b.2. Lead-lanthanum-zirconium titanate and variants; b.3. Lithium tantalate; b.4. Polyvinylidene fluoride and variants; or b.5. Strontium barium niobate and variants. c. “Focal plane arrays” “specially designed” or modified to achieve `charge multiplication' and limited by design to have a maximum “radiant sensitivity” of 10 mA/W or less for wavelengths exceeding 760 nm, having all of the following: c.1. Incorporating a response limiting mechanism designed not to be removed or modified; and c.2. Any of the following: c.2.a. The response limiting mechanism is integral to or combined with the detector element; or c.2.b. The “focal plane array” is only operable with the response limiting mechanism in place. d. Thermopile arrays having less than 5,130 elements;

content.html:
Technical Note:

A response limiting mechanism integral to the detector element is designed not to be removed or modified without rendering the detector inoperable.
content.text: Technical Note: A response limiting mechanism integral to the detector element is designed not to be removed or modified without rendering the detector inoperable.

b.4. Polyvinylidene fluoride and variants; or

b.5. Strontium barium niobate and variants.

c. “Focal plane arrays” “specially designed” or modified to achieve `charge multiplication' and limited by design to have a maximum “radiant sensitivity” of 10 mA/W or less for wavelengths exceeding 760 nm, having all of the following:

c.1. Incorporating a response limiting mechanism designed not to be removed or modified; and

c.2. Any of the following:

c.2.a. The response limiting mechanism is integral to or combined with the detector element; or

c.2.b. The “focal plane array” is only operable with the response limiting mechanism in place.

d. Thermopile arrays having less than 5,130 elements;
content.text: Note 2: 6A002.a.3 does not control: a. Multi-element (not to exceed 16 elements) encapsulated photoconductive cells using either lead sulphide or lead selenide; b. Pyroelectric detectors using any of the following: b.1. Triglycine sulphate and variants; b.2. Lead-lanthanum-zirconium titanate and variants; b.3. Lithium tantalate; b.4. Polyvinylidene fluoride and variants; or b.5. Strontium barium niobate and variants. c. “Focal plane arrays” “specially designed” or modified to achieve `charge multiplication' and limited by design to have a maximum “radiant sensitivity” of 10 mA/W or less for wavelengths exceeding 760 nm, having all of the following: c.1. Incorporating a response limiting mechanism designed not to be removed or modified; and c.2. Any of the following: c.2.a. The response limiting mechanism is integral to or combined with the detector element; or c.2.b. The “focal plane array” is only operable with the response limiting mechanism in place. d. Thermopile arrays having less than 5,130 elements;

A response limiting mechanism integral to the detector element is designed not to be removed or modified without rendering the detector inoperable.

content.html:
Technical Note:

Linear or two-dimensional multi-element detector arrays are referred to as “focal plane arrays”;
content.text: Technical Note: Linear or two-dimensional multi-element detector arrays are referred to as “focal plane arrays”;

content.html:
Note 1:

6A002.a.3 includes photoconductive arrays and photovoltaic arrays.
content.text: Note 1: 6A002.a.3 includes photoconductive arrays and photovoltaic arrays.

content.html:
Note 2:

6A002.a.3 does not control:

a. Multi-element (not to exceed 16 elements) encapsulated photoconductive cells using either lead sulphide or lead selenide;

b. Pyroelectric detectors using any of the following:

b.1. Triglycine sulphate and variants;

b.2. Lead-lanthanum-zirconium titanate and variants;

b.3. Lithium tantalate;

b.4. Polyvinylidene fluoride and variants; or

b.5. Strontium barium niobate and variants.

c. “Focal plane arrays” “specially designed” or modified to achieve `charge multiplication' and limited by design to have a maximum “radiant sensitivity” of 10 mA/W or less for wavelengths exceeding 760 nm, having all of the following:

c.1. Incorporating a response limiting mechanism designed not to be removed or modified; and

c.2. Any of the following:

c.2.a. The response limiting mechanism is integral to or combined with the detector element; or

c.2.b. The “focal plane array” is only operable with the response limiting mechanism in place.

d. Thermopile arrays having less than 5,130 elements;

For the purposes of 6A002.a.3.f, 'microbolometer' is defined as a thermal imaging detector that, as a result of a temperature change in the detector caused by the absorption of infrared radiation, is used to generate any usable signal.

content.html: N.B.: 'Microbolometer' non-“space-qualified” “focal plane arrays” are only specified by 6A002.a.3.f.
content.text: N.B.: 'Microbolometer' non-“space-qualified” “focal plane arrays” are only specified by 6A002.a.3.f.

content.html:
Technical Note:

Linear or two-dimensional multi-element detector arrays are referred to as “focal plane arrays”;
content.text: Technical Note: Linear or two-dimensional multi-element detector arrays are referred to as “focal plane arrays”;

content.html:
Note 1:

6A002.a.3 includes photoconductive arrays and photovoltaic arrays.
content.text: Note 1: 6A002.a.3 includes photoconductive arrays and photovoltaic arrays.

content.html:
Note 2:

6A002.a.3 does not control:

a. Multi-element (not to exceed 16 elements) encapsulated photoconductive cells using either lead sulphide or lead selenide;

b. Pyroelectric detectors using any of the following:

b.1. Triglycine sulphate and variants;

b.2. Lead-lanthanum-zirconium titanate and variants;

b.3. Lithium tantalate;

b.4. Polyvinylidene fluoride and variants; or

b.5. Strontium barium niobate and variants.

c. “Focal plane arrays” “specially designed” or modified to achieve `charge multiplication' and limited by design to have a maximum “radiant sensitivity” of 10 mA/W or less for wavelengths exceeding 760 nm, having all of the following:

c.1. Incorporating a response limiting mechanism designed not to be removed or modified; and

c.2. Any of the following:

c.2.a. The response limiting mechanism is integral to or combined with the detector element; or

c.2.b. The “focal plane array” is only operable with the response limiting mechanism in place.

d. Thermopile arrays having less than 5,130 elements;
content.text: Note 2: 6A002.a.3 does not control: a. Multi-element (not to exceed 16 elements) encapsulated photoconductive cells using either lead sulphide or lead selenide; b. Pyroelectric detectors using any of the following: b.1. Triglycine sulphate and variants; b.2. Lead-lanthanum-zirconium titanate and variants; b.3. Lithium tantalate; b.4. Polyvinylidene fluoride and variants; or b.5. Strontium barium niobate and variants. c. “Focal plane arrays” “specially designed” or modified to achieve `charge multiplication' and limited by design to have a maximum “radiant sensitivity” of 10 mA/W or less for wavelengths exceeding 760 nm, having all of the following: c.1. Incorporating a response limiting mechanism designed not to be removed or modified; and c.2. Any of the following: c.2.a. The response limiting mechanism is integral to or combined with the detector element; or c.2.b. The “focal plane array” is only operable with the response limiting mechanism in place. d. Thermopile arrays having less than 5,130 elements;

content.html:
Technical Note:

A response limiting mechanism integral to the detector element is designed not to be removed or modified without rendering the detector inoperable.
content.text: Technical Note: A response limiting mechanism integral to the detector element is designed not to be removed or modified without rendering the detector inoperable.

content.html: N.B.: 'Microbolometer' non-“space-qualified” “focal plane arrays” are only specified by 6A002.a.3.f.
content.text: N.B.: 'Microbolometer' non-“space-qualified” “focal plane arrays” are only specified by 6A002.a.3.f.

content.html:
Technical Note:

Linear or two-dimensional multi-element detector arrays are referred to as “focal plane arrays”;
content.text: Technical Note: Linear or two-dimensional multi-element detector arrays are referred to as “focal plane arrays”;

content.html:
Note 1:

6A002.a.3 includes photoconductive arrays and photovoltaic arrays.
content.text: Note 1: 6A002.a.3 includes photoconductive arrays and photovoltaic arrays.

content.html:
Note 2:

6A002.a.3 does not control:

a. Multi-element (not to exceed 16 elements) encapsulated photoconductive cells using either lead sulphide or lead selenide;

b. Pyroelectric detectors using any of the following:

b.1. Triglycine sulphate and variants;

b.2. Lead-lanthanum-zirconium titanate and variants;

b.3. Lithium tantalate;

b.4. Polyvinylidene fluoride and variants; or

b.5. Strontium barium niobate and variants.

c. “Focal plane arrays” “specially designed” or modified to achieve `charge multiplication' and limited by design to have a maximum “radiant sensitivity” of 10 mA/W or less for wavelengths exceeding 760 nm, having all of the following:

c.1. Incorporating a response limiting mechanism designed not to be removed or modified; and

c.2. Any of the following:

c.2.a. The response limiting mechanism is integral to or combined with the detector element; or

c.2.b. The “focal plane array” is only operable with the response limiting mechanism in place.

d. Thermopile arrays having less than 5,130 elements;
content.text: Note 2: 6A002.a.3 does not control: a. Multi-element (not to exceed 16 elements) encapsulated photoconductive cells using either lead sulphide or lead selenide; b. Pyroelectric detectors using any of the following: b.1. Triglycine sulphate and variants; b.2. Lead-lanthanum-zirconium titanate and variants; b.3. Lithium tantalate; b.4. Polyvinylidene fluoride and variants; or b.5. Strontium barium niobate and variants. c. “Focal plane arrays” “specially designed” or modified to achieve `charge multiplication' and limited by design to have a maximum “radiant sensitivity” of 10 mA/W or less for wavelengths exceeding 760 nm, having all of the following: c.1. Incorporating a response limiting mechanism designed not to be removed or modified; and c.2. Any of the following: c.2.a. The response limiting mechanism is integral to or combined with the detector element; or c.2.b. The “focal plane array” is only operable with the response limiting mechanism in place. d. Thermopile arrays having less than 5,130 elements;

content.html:
Technical Note:

A response limiting mechanism integral to the detector element is designed not to be removed or modified without rendering the detector inoperable.
content.text: Technical Note: A response limiting mechanism integral to the detector element is designed not to be removed or modified without rendering the detector inoperable.

supplement.heading: Supplement No. 1 to Part 774 - The Commerce Control List

breadcrumbs: 6A002 Optical Sensors and Equipment, and “Components” Therefor, as Follows (see List of Items Controlled).

content.html: N.B.: 'Microbolometer' non-“space-qualified” “focal plane arrays” are only specified by 6A002.a.3.f.
content.text: N.B.: 'Microbolometer' non-“space-qualified” “focal plane arrays” are only specified by 6A002.a.3.f.

content.html:
Technical Note:

Linear or two-dimensional multi-element detector arrays are referred to as “focal plane arrays”;
content.text: Technical Note: Linear or two-dimensional multi-element detector arrays are referred to as “focal plane arrays”;

content.html:
Note 1:

6A002.a.3 includes photoconductive arrays and photovoltaic arrays.
content.text: Note 1: 6A002.a.3 includes photoconductive arrays and photovoltaic arrays.

content.html:
Note 2:

6A002.a.3 does not control:

a. Multi-element (not to exceed 16 elements) encapsulated photoconductive cells using either lead sulphide or lead selenide;

b. Pyroelectric detectors using any of the following:

b.1. Triglycine sulphate and variants;

b.2. Lead-lanthanum-zirconium titanate and variants;

b.3. Lithium tantalate;

b.4. Polyvinylidene fluoride and variants; or

b.5. Strontium barium niobate and variants.

c. “Focal plane arrays” “specially designed” or modified to achieve `charge multiplication' and limited by design to have a maximum “radiant sensitivity” of 10 mA/W or less for wavelengths exceeding 760 nm, having all of the following:

c.1. Incorporating a response limiting mechanism designed not to be removed or modified; and

c.2. Any of the following:

c.2.a. The response limiting mechanism is integral to or combined with the detector element; or

c.2.b. The “focal plane array” is only operable with the response limiting mechanism in place.

d. Thermopile arrays having less than 5,130 elements;
content.text: Note 2: 6A002.a.3 does not control: a. Multi-element (not to exceed 16 elements) encapsulated photoconductive cells using either lead sulphide or lead selenide; b. Pyroelectric detectors using any of the following: b.1. Triglycine sulphate and variants; b.2. Lead-lanthanum-zirconium titanate and variants; b.3. Lithium tantalate; b.4. Polyvinylidene fluoride and variants; or b.5. Strontium barium niobate and variants. c. “Focal plane arrays” “specially designed” or modified to achieve `charge multiplication' and limited by design to have a maximum “radiant sensitivity” of 10 mA/W or less for wavelengths exceeding 760 nm, having all of the following: c.1. Incorporating a response limiting mechanism designed not to be removed or modified; and c.2. Any of the following: c.2.a. The response limiting mechanism is integral to or combined with the detector element; or c.2.b. The “focal plane array” is only operable with the response limiting mechanism in place. d. Thermopile arrays having less than 5,130 elements;

content.html:
Technical Note:

A response limiting mechanism integral to the detector element is designed not to be removed or modified without rendering the detector inoperable.
content.text: Technical Note: A response limiting mechanism integral to the detector element is designed not to be removed or modified without rendering the detector inoperable.

Note 2:

6A002.a.3 does not control:

a. Multi-element (not to exceed 16 elements) encapsulated photoconductive cells using either lead sulphide or lead selenide;

b. Pyroelectric detectors using any of the following:

b.1. Triglycine sulphate and variants;

b.2. Lead-lanthanum-zirconium titanate and variants;

b.3. Lithium tantalate;

b.4. Polyvinylidene fluoride and variants; or

b.5. Strontium barium niobate and variants.

c. “Focal plane arrays” “specially designed” or modified to achieve `charge multiplication' and limited by design to have a maximum “radiant sensitivity” of 10 mA/W or less for wavelengths exceeding 760 nm, having all of the following:

c.1. Incorporating a response limiting mechanism designed not to be removed or modified; and

c.2. Any of the following:

c.2.a. The response limiting mechanism is integral to or combined with the detector element; or

c.2.b. The “focal plane array” is only operable with the response limiting mechanism in place.

d. Thermopile arrays having less than 5,130 elements;
content.text: Note 2: 6A002.a.3 does not control: a. Multi-element (not to exceed 16 elements) encapsulated photoconductive cells using either lead sulphide or lead selenide; b. Pyroelectric detectors using any of the following: b.1. Triglycine sulphate and variants; b.2. Lead-lanthanum-zirconium titanate and variants; b.3. Lithium tantalate; b.4. Polyvinylidene fluoride and variants; or b.5. Strontium barium niobate and variants. c. “Focal plane arrays” “specially designed” or modified to achieve `charge multiplication' and limited by design to have a maximum “radiant sensitivity” of 10 mA/W or less for wavelengths exceeding 760 nm, having all of the following: c.1. Incorporating a response limiting mechanism designed not to be removed or modified; and c.2. Any of the following: c.2.a. The response limiting mechanism is integral to or combined with the detector element; or c.2.b. The “focal plane array” is only operable with the response limiting mechanism in place. d. Thermopile arrays having less than 5,130 elements;

Technical Note:

A response limiting mechanism integral to the detector element is designed not to be removed or modified without rendering the detector inoperable.

d. Thermopile arrays having less than 5,130 elements;

content.html: N.B.: 'Microbolometer' non-“space-qualified” “focal plane arrays” are only specified by 6A002.a.3.f.
content.text: N.B.: 'Microbolometer' non-“space-qualified” “focal plane arrays” are only specified by 6A002.a.3.f.

content.html:
Technical Note:

Linear or two-dimensional multi-element detector arrays are referred to as “focal plane arrays”;
content.text: Technical Note: Linear or two-dimensional multi-element detector arrays are referred to as “focal plane arrays”;

content.html:
Note 1:

6A002.a.3 includes photoconductive arrays and photovoltaic arrays.
content.text: Note 1: 6A002.a.3 includes photoconductive arrays and photovoltaic arrays.

content.html:
Note 2:

6A002.a.3 does not control:

a. Multi-element (not to exceed 16 elements) encapsulated photoconductive cells using either lead sulphide or lead selenide;

b. Pyroelectric detectors using any of the following:

b.1. Triglycine sulphate and variants;

b.2. Lead-lanthanum-zirconium titanate and variants;

b.3. Lithium tantalate;

b.4. Polyvinylidene fluoride and variants; or

b.5. Strontium barium niobate and variants.

c. “Focal plane arrays” “specially designed” or modified to achieve `charge multiplication' and limited by design to have a maximum “radiant sensitivity” of 10 mA/W or less for wavelengths exceeding 760 nm, having all of the following:

c.1. Incorporating a response limiting mechanism designed not to be removed or modified; and

c.2. Any of the following:

c.2.a. The response limiting mechanism is integral to or combined with the detector element; or

c.2.b. The “focal plane array” is only operable with the response limiting mechanism in place.

d. Thermopile arrays having less than 5,130 elements;
content.text: Note 2: 6A002.a.3 does not control: a. Multi-element (not to exceed 16 elements) encapsulated photoconductive cells using either lead sulphide or lead selenide; b. Pyroelectric detectors using any of the following: b.1. Triglycine sulphate and variants; b.2. Lead-lanthanum-zirconium titanate and variants; b.3. Lithium tantalate; b.4. Polyvinylidene fluoride and variants; or b.5. Strontium barium niobate and variants. c. “Focal plane arrays” “specially designed” or modified to achieve `charge multiplication' and limited by design to have a maximum “radiant sensitivity” of 10 mA/W or less for wavelengths exceeding 760 nm, having all of the following: c.1. Incorporating a response limiting mechanism designed not to be removed or modified; and c.2. Any of the following: c.2.a. The response limiting mechanism is integral to or combined with the detector element; or c.2.b. The “focal plane array” is only operable with the response limiting mechanism in place. d. Thermopile arrays having less than 5,130 elements;

content.html:
Technical Note:

A response limiting mechanism integral to the detector element is designed not to be removed or modified without rendering the detector inoperable.
content.text: Technical Note: A response limiting mechanism integral to the detector element is designed not to be removed or modified without rendering the detector inoperable.

history.heading: Non-“space-qualified” “focal plane arrays” as follows:
history.title: Non-“space-qualified” “focal plane arrays” as follows:

supplement.heading: Supplement No. 1 to Part 774—The Commerce Control List

breadcrumbs: 6A002 Optical Sensors and Equipment, and “Components” Therefor, as Follows (see List of Items Controlled).

content.html: N.B.: 'Microbolometer' non-“space-qualified” “focal plane arrays” are only specified by 6A002.a.3.f.
content.text: N.B.: 'Microbolometer' non-“space-qualified” “focal plane arrays” are only specified by 6A002.a.3.f.

content.html:
Technical Note:

Linear or two-dimensional multi-element detector arrays are referred to as “focal plane arrays”;
content.text: Technical Note: Linear or two-dimensional multi-element detector arrays are referred to as “focal plane arrays”;

content.html:
Note 1:

6A002.a.3 includes photoconductive arrays and photovoltaic arrays.
content.text: Note 1: 6A002.a.3 includes photoconductive arrays and photovoltaic arrays.

content.html:
Note 2:

6A002.a.3 does not control:

a. Multi-element (not to exceed 16 elements) encapsulated photoconductive cells using either lead sulphide or lead selenide;

b. Pyroelectric detectors using any of the following:

b.1. Triglycine sulphate and variants;

b.2. Lead-lanthanum-zirconium titanate and variants;

b.3. Lithium tantalate;

b.4. Polyvinylidene fluoride and variants; or

b.5. Strontium barium niobate and variants.

c. “Focal plane arrays” “specially designed” or modified to achieve `charge multiplication' and limited by design to have a maximum “radiant sensitivity” of 10 mA/W or less for wavelengths exceeding 760 nm, having all of the following:

c.1. Incorporating a response limiting mechanism designed not to be removed or modified; and

c.2. Any of the following:

c.2.a. The response limiting mechanism is integral to or combined with the detector element; or

c.2.b. The “focal plane array” is only operable with the response limiting mechanism in place.

d. Thermopile arrays having less than 5,130 elements;
content.text: Note 2: 6A002.a.3 does not control: a. Multi-element (not to exceed 16 elements) encapsulated photoconductive cells using either lead sulphide or lead selenide; b. Pyroelectric detectors using any of the following: b.1. Triglycine sulphate and variants; b.2. Lead-lanthanum-zirconium titanate and variants; b.3. Lithium tantalate; b.4. Polyvinylidene fluoride and variants; or b.5. Strontium barium niobate and variants. c. “Focal plane arrays” “specially designed” or modified to achieve `charge multiplication' and limited by design to have a maximum “radiant sensitivity” of 10 mA/W or less for wavelengths exceeding 760 nm, having all of the following: c.1. Incorporating a response limiting mechanism designed not to be removed or modified; and c.2. Any of the following: c.2.a. The response limiting mechanism is integral to or combined with the detector element; or c.2.b. The “focal plane array” is only operable with the response limiting mechanism in place. d. Thermopile arrays having less than 5,130 elements;

content.html:
Technical Note:

A response limiting mechanism integral to the detector element is designed not to be removed or modified without rendering the detector inoperable.
content.text: Technical Note: A response limiting mechanism integral to the detector element is designed not to be removed or modified without rendering the detector inoperable.
